etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin discriminat- ‘distinguished between’, from the verb discriminare, from discrimen ‘distinction’, from the verb discernere (see discern)

definitions: make an unjust or prejudicial distinction in the treatment of different categories of people, especially on the grounds of ethnicity, sex, age, or disability

examples.text: existing employment policies discriminate against women

shortDefinitions: make unjust or prejudicial distinction in treatment of different categories of people

examples.text: babies can discriminate between different facial expressions

definitions: perceive or constitute the difference in or between

examples.text: features that discriminate this species from other gastropods

shortDefinitions: perceive or constitute difference in or between
